intro: Microstylis decurrens, commonly known as the creeping microstylis, is a small herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wet, acidic soils along stream banks and in swampy areas. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in clusters. Microstylis decurrens is often found in wetland ecosystems and plays a role in stabilizing soil in these habitats.
